The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 28 March is 41,344 (4,785.3 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 23 March, there were 227 new confirmed cases (26.3 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 16 March, there were 309 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 27% (82 fewer cases).
